docs.lead_paragraph: With George Clooney and Gwyneth Paltrow and god knows who else spilling out of the Vanity Fair Oscar party, one fan took off running to catch up with a short man whose car was parked away from the queue. The kid, who had thick glasses and seemed to be hyperventilating, was blocked by a security guy.

docs.snippet: Memo to Staff: This year, let's make the Oscar program booklet cool and unusable....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oscar program book would seem to be a fairly straightforward affair -- a user-friendly booklet that allows the audience to follow along, right? Not so fast. In an instance of fixing something that was not broken in the first place, the Academy came up with a horizontal booklet that was a foot long and six inches tall. It had a rivet in the middle so the thing only opened up halfway and the type ran both horizontally and vertically. The Bagger saw a number of people try to figure out how to use it -- it was plenty handsome -- then give it a toss.
docs.abstract: Memo to Staff: This year, let's make the Oscar program booklet cool and unusable.

headline.main: The Dumbest Thing at the Oscars Besides the Security Guys

docs.lead_paragraph: In Rhinebeck, N.Y., founders of the Omega Institute for Holistic Studies say they have grown enormously from their days as old crunchy granola stereotypes.

docs.snippet: Up and away -- the Bagger returns to his grubby East Coast life....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger has gone to his happy place, the smoking cage at LAX. The muse comes quickly here -- at least it had better, the flight leaves in 22 minutes.
docs.abstract: Up and away -- the Bagger returns to his grubby East Coast life.

docs.snippet: The Bagger shakes this year's accumulated Oscar memories out of his brain and onto the blog....
docs.lead_paragraph: Today, the Oscarator will heave and buck, throwing the Bagger clear somewhere near LAX, where, if his luck holds, he'll be able to hail a flight back to Jersey. (Please, guy with arms like hams , take another flight.)
docs.abstract: The Bagger shakes this year's accumulated Oscar memories out of his brain and onto the blog.

docs.snippet: A club built to keep out the Bagger and his ilk....
docs.lead_paragraph: Defamer went to the Oscar Soho House so you didn't have to. You aren't fabulous or vacuous enough to get in anyway. The Bagger gets skeeved out when he goes to the one in Manhattan -- it seems like the kind of club they built to get away from people like him -- so he wasn't exactly trying to bust the door at the West Coast version.
docs.abstract: A club built to keep out the Bagger and his ilk.

docs.snippet: Campaigning for an Oscar costs big money. Is there a payoff?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Reuters asks whether the millions and millions of dollars spent on Oscar campaigning actually went down a rat hole.
docs.abstract: Campaigning for an Oscar costs big money. Is there a payoff?
